sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SCYROS, an iſland in the Ægean ſea, at the diſtance of about 28 miles north-eaſt from Eubcea. It is 6o miles in circumſerence. It was originally in the poſſeſſion of the Pelaſgians and Carians. Achilles retired there to avoid going to the Trojan war, and became father of Neoptolemus by Deidamia the daughter of king Lycomedes. Scyros was conquered by the Athenians under Cimon. It was very rocky and barren. Now Sciro. E. Long. 25. O. N. Lat. 38. 15.
